content.description: This super fun problem begins with a sit start on the lowest diagonal on the face. Work your way through sidepulls and crimps to top out on some high friction slopers. You may want to make sure the slopers are free of dirt and pine needles before attempting.
content.location: Straight down the hill from the Linearly Dependent boulder ~30 feet. This problem faces the river.

content.description: Climb the right side of the Arete next to Linearly Dependent. It's mossy, but will clean up nice.
content.location: Start on the jugs at the bottom of the arete. Work your way up and to the right.

content.description:
This problem is on the boulder you can see from the road. It is on the featured orange and black streaked face, a few feet left of a sharp arete. The start can be done in several ways, depending on how much you want to challenge yourself. Use the low side-pull crimps to get going (or the jugs on the arete if you want to take it easy). Work your way up through positive crimps and a lone left facing mini jug to the top out.

Down climb the slab right of the arete. This is the crux, especially if you are shorter.
content.protection: A pad is good. The top-out is straight forward but slightly awkward.
content.location: This problem is located on the first boulder that is visible from the road.
